title: 107_hr275
content: The "Family Values Tax Relief Act of 2001" is the short title of the Act. It includes the repeal of the overall limitation on itemized deductions. The "Family Values Tax Relief Act of 2001" repeals the overall limitation on itemized deductions and the phaseout of personal exemptions for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. The "Family Values Tax Relief Act of 2001" repeals the overall limitation on itemized deductions and the phaseout of personal exemptions for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. Subsection (d) of section 151 is amended by striking paragraph (3) and technical amendments are made to section 1(f) and section 151(d). The amendments made by the "Family Values Tax Relief Act of 2001" apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000, including adjustments to the cost-of-living for the calendar year. SEC. 4 of the "Family Values Tax Relief Act of 2001" repeals the adjusted gross income limitation in the child tax credit by amending Section 24. It also includes a conforming amendment to Clause (ii) of section 32(n)(1)(B). The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. SEC. 5 repeals the alternative minimum tax on individuals. The amendment to section 55 eliminates alternative minimum tax for individuals starting after December 31, 2000. Conforming amendments are made to sections 1, 2, and 24. Section 4 is amended by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2). Subsection (a) of section 26 is amended to limit the aggregate amount of credits allowed. Subsection (c) of section 26 is amended to treat the amount as zero for non-corporate taxpayers. Paragraph (6) of section 29(b) is amended to limit the credit allowed based on the regular tax liability. Section 4 is amended by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2). Subsection (a) of section 26 is amended to limit the aggregate amount of credits allowed. Subsection (c) of section 26 is amended to treat the amount as zero for non-corporate taxpayers. Paragraph (6) of section 29(b) is amended to limit the credit allowed based on the regular tax liability. Paragraph (3) of section 30(b) is amended to restrict the credit allowed by subsection (a) for any taxable year to not exceed the regular tax reduced by certain credits. Section 32 is amended by striking subsection (h). Section 32 is amended by striking subsection (h). Subsection (d) of section 53(d) is amended to define 'net minimum tax' and 'tentative minimum tax' for tax purposes. The amendment to section 55 of the tax code changes the calculation of the tentative minimum tax for individuals, with adjustments to alternative minimum taxable income and foreign tax credits. The amendment to section 55 of the tax code modifies the exemption amount to $40,000 and includes a phase-out provision reducing the exemption amount by 25 percent for certain taxpayers. The tax code amendment adjusts the exemption amount to $40,000 with a phase-out provision reducing it by 25 percent for certain taxpayers. Section 56 is also amended to change the adjusted basis determination for property. Section 56 is amended by moving subsections (d) and (g) to subsections (b) and (c), respectively. Section 58 is repealed, and section 59 is amended by removing references to sections 56, 57, and 58. Section 59 is further amended by removing subsections (c) and (j), while section 382(l) is amended by changing references from section 56(d) to section 56(b). Additionally, section 641(c) is amended by reorganizing subparagraphs. Sections 847, 848(i), 871(b)(1), and 877(b) are each amended by removing specific references and inserting new ones. Subsection (a) of section 897 is also amended regarding the gain or loss of a nonresident alien individual or foreign corporation from the disposition of a United States real property interest. The amendments made in this section include changes to various sections such as 871(b)(1), 882(a)(1), 962(a), 1397E(c), 1563(a), and 6015(d)(2). The effective date of these amendments is specified. The amendments made in this section, including changes to specific sections, will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2000.
